intro: Spartothamnella canescens, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub characterized by its gray-green, succulent leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to drought conditions, with thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. Its flowering period attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat. Spartothamnella canescens is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
